definitions.definition: from a time in the past until a later past time, or until now

examples.text: She's been off work since Tuesday.
He's been working in a bank since leaving school.
Since the party she had only spoken to him once.
That was years ago. I've changed jobs **since then**.

definitions.definition: used when you are showing that you are angry about something

examples.text: Since when did he ever listen to me?

wordOrigin: late Middle English: contraction of obsolete sithence, or from dialect sin (both from dialect sithen ‘thereupon, afterwards, ever since’).
